page.title: 03LIVE STOCK (CATTLE)
page.content: The farms in the{Bolam} area stock a number of different types of cattle. The Holstiens and Friesians are the best for dairy products,Herefords, Charalais and Limosins are the best for beef.The average price to buy a cow would be Â£425.00 and the average price to sell would be Â£488.00. The markets that the farmers go to are {Darlington,Barnard Castle}and{Tow Law. It is know for cows to have calfs in the spring.They usually have 1_2 calfs every year.They sometimes slaughter a cow when it is about 4_6 years old.A cow when it is fully grown usually weighs about 112_120kg.The average number of cows to the acre is two.The farmers feed their cows and calfs in winter on hay,cow cake and oats.
